parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2oa </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.62</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Math - Geometry </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns objects intersecting with the virtual line from ''begPos'' to ''endPos''. By default resulting array of intersecting objects is unsorted. To sort by distance set ''sortByDistance'' param to [[true]]. <br><br><template><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Doesn't work under water. Max hardcoded distance is 1000m.</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''lineIntersectsWith''' [begPos, endPos, objIgnore1, objIgnore2, sortByDistance] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [begPos, endPos, objIgnore1, objIgnore2, sortByDistance]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> begPos: [[PositionASL]] - virtual line start </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> endPos: [[PositionASL]] - virtual line end </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> objIgnore1: (optional) [[Object]] - object to ignore. When testing intersection from an object/unit/vehicle, pass that object here to prevent intersection inside of the object.</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> objIgnore2: (optional) [[Object]] - another object to ignore. When testing intersection of a line between two objects, pass the second object here to prevent intersection inside of it being reported</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER5</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value> sortByDistance: (optional) [[Boolean]] - [[true]]: Sort by distance =&gt; furthermost object first, closest object last; [[false]]: unsorted </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER6</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - intersecting objects </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_objects = [[lineIntersectsWith]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[eyePos]] [[player]], [[AGLtoASL]] [[screenToWorld]] [0.5,0.5]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Sort by distance: <code>_objects = [[lineIntersectsWith]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[eyePos]] [[player]], [[AGLtoASL]] [[screenToWorld]] [0.5,0.5], [[objNull]], [[objNull]], [[true]]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Ignore objects: <code>_objects = [[lineIntersectsWith]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[eyePos]] [[player]], [[aimPos]] chopper, [[player]], chopper];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[lineIntersectsSurfaces]], [[lineIntersectsObjs]], [[intersect]], [[terrainIntersect]], [[terrainIntersectASL]], [[terrainIntersectAtASL]], [[lineIntersects]], [[cursorObject]], [[cursorTarget]], [[checkVisibility]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
